result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

3:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Allen Denson appeared by video, in custody. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol
Initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
